page.title: 13LANDSCAPE. CHANGING USAGE.
page.content: Burning the moor kills all the vegetation. Most of the plants that are killed are the ones commonly found. Some are grown from seeds that are blown onto the moor. Another way that the vegetation is killed is by grazing.{Sheep grazing}is one of the main uses of the moor. The sheep eat the young shoots of{heather and fine {grass,}therefore effecting the amount of{heather.}This lets other plants invade the area particularly {crowberry. Carr Bottom reservoir}is the only one in our area serving the village of{Burley Woodhead.}It is also used to store water in case of drought.{Carr Bottom reservoir}is inside the{rifle range.}This was created during the{Boar War}in{1861.} It is owned by the {Ministry of {Defence.}It is used 3 or 4 times a week. The warden{Mr.Greaves}also owns
